post.summary: Send a new message to be stored within EIP
post.description: Single endpoint to receive a message and associated metadata.

202.description:
Accepted - The message was accepted and stored in its raw format.

At this point, it doesn't not mean the message is valid or accurate since no validations or transformations will be performed on this stage.

400.description: Bad Request - The JSON sent is not parseable or acceptable.

examples.text/plain: Unable to parse payload sent to EIP Transport Service.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Required Metadata is missing. This request is unprocessable.

examples.text/plain: Payload sent is missing the HL7 content

500.description: Internal Server Error - If persistence fails, or any other internal issues arises.

examples.text/plain: We are unable to process your request at this moment. The message has not been received. Please try again later or contact EIP's system administrator.

get.summary: Retrieves the current status for the given message.

parameters.name: GUID
parameters.description: The GUID for the message we want to retrieve the status for

200.description: The message exists and the current status is returned.

404.description: The GUID provided does not exists on the system.

500.description: Unable to process the request due to some Internal Server errors.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of messages for a given timeframe and their status

parameters.name: system_id
parameters.description: the System ID that we want messages received from

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: the start date for received messages.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: the end date for received messages. If not provided, assumes current date.

200.description: The list of messages received from system_id for the given timeframe (start_date, end_date).

version.description: The current version of this message. Currently only 1.0 supported.

content.description: The actual content of the message - the HL7 message itself.

content_length.description: The length in bytes of the content. Optional. Will be calculated by EIP if not present.

hash.description: The hash for this message (content only). Can be used to validate the content has not been modified. Optional. will be calculated by EIP if not present.

multipart.description: Whether the message is sent in multiple parts (batch/chunk)

multipart_id.description: If the message is multipart (multipart=true), this property holds the identifier of each multipart.

multipart_index.description: The order in which the parts should be assembled. The index should start at 0 and follow sequentially. This attribute is ignored if multipart = false.

multipart_total.description:
The total number of parts that comprises this message.
(multipart_index should be sequential from 0 to multipart_total-1)

SOURCE_SYSTEM.description:
Holds information specific to the system that is sending the message. Several source instances can be concatenated with 'received_from' to track all systems this message passed through before reaching EIP (if the information is available).
At least one source should be present. AIMS should create an instance of this object to hold its own information. Further source systems can be appended using the recieved_from attribute.

system.description: What type of system is sending the information. Possible values are PHINMS, MIRTH, etc.

system_location.description:
Where the system is installed at - the owner/administrator of the system.
It could be the Jurisdiction which operates the system, AIMS (APHL), etc.

system_id.description: The identifier of the system that is sending the message. Should be unique for each system install sending messages.

msg_identifier.description: The identifier for the message on this specific system. This could be used for tracking a message back on the original system.

received_time.description: The time that the source system received the message. If it's the last system to send the message to EIP, this should hold the current timestamp as received_time.

recipient.description: If available from the source, this will contain the information about the intended recipient of the message. If this information cannot be derived from the source, this field will be null.

sender.description: If available from the source, this will contain the information about the sender of the message. If this information cannot be derived from the source, this field will be null.

source_attributes.description: List of Name-value pairs of additional information provided by the source of the message.
